result.execSummary:
The defendant Brandon Alexander Lovingood was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

supervisions.notes: PROBATION REVIEW HEARING NOVEMBER 13, 2015 AT 1:15 P.M. IN BR. 38.

miscConds.notes: Pay all applicable costs and surcharges, victim witness surcharges, the domestic violence surcharge, and supervision fees as determined by DOC.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the No Contact Order and due to this DV conviction he may never possess firearms or ammunition.

No violent contact with the victim rising to the level of probable cause for arrest.
No firearms, weapons.

Successfully complete Batterers Intervention.
Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
Pay all supervision fees as determined by DOC.
Participate in alcohol and drug assessment.   Successfully complete recommended treatment including random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brandon Alexander Lovingood

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Defendant Brandon Alexander Lovingood in court.  Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Defendant is compliant or mostly compliant with probation.  The remaining condition time is stayed.  Court found that further review is not needed.

Defendant Brandon Alexander Lovingood in court with attorney Torrie R. Williams.  Elizabeth Longo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Count 1 is ordered dismissed and read in upon motion of the state.
Count 2:    Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, and further advised that if not a United States citizen deportation is possible. Defendant examined as to plea, and entered a plea of guilty.  Court found defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived all constitutional rights. Plea questionnaire waiver of rights and addendum to plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulated to the criminal complaint as factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered into the record.  
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by parties.  Additional statement by Tabitha L.
Defendant sentenced to serve 6 months in the House of Correction with credit for 2 days time served.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 18 months.
*
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
-As a condition of probation, the Court ordered the defendant to serve 25 days in the House of Correction.  This time is stayed pending a review on 11-13-2015 at 1:15pm.
-Successfully complete "Batterers intervention" 
-Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including random urine screens.
-Maintain absolute sobriety.
-Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
-NO VIOLENT CONTACT with the victim rising to the level of probable cause for arrest.
Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges, victim/witness surcharge, the domestic violence surcharge, and supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
-Defendant to pay all supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.
-Obtain and maintain employment.
-No firearms; weapons.
Received and filed: Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Memorandum of Conditions of Probation.  Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction he may never possess firearms or ammunition.  Case adjourned to Branch 38.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for November 13, 2015 at 01:15 pm.

Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge KREMERS.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Wagner, Br. 38. Court Vacated dates before branch 36.

Defendant Brandon Alexander Lovingood in court with attorney Torrie R. Williams.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin. FILE NOT IN COURT. Case called to address Substitution of Judge at request of defense. Case adjourned for  Plea & Sentencing date.   Parties are notified that effective August 1, 2015 this case will be reassigned per rotation to Judge Jeffrey Kremers, Branch 36 in Courthouse room 502.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 19, 2015 at 08:15 am.

Defendant Brandon Alexander Lovingood in court with attorney Torrie R. Williams.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case RECALLED. 
Branch 23 is in trial, case is adjourned for Final Pretrial & Jury Trial.  All conditions of bail remain in effect. Parties are notified that effective August 3, 2015 this case will be reassigned to per rotation to a branch of the Circuit Court to be determined. Case adjourned for Final Pretrial & Jury Trial.

Defendant Brandon Alexander Lovingood in court with attorney Torrie R. Williams.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 1st call, Case set for Jury Trial. Parties ready to proceed to trial. Case passed to address court calendar.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 4, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for August 12, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Brandon Alexander Lovingood in court with attorney Torrie R. Williams.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense requests a Jury Trial date. Court ordered all motions filed and discovery turned over 20 DAYS prior to Jury Trial. All conditions of bail remain in effect. Case adjourned to branch 23.  Jury trial scheduled for May 6, 2015 at 08:30 am.

No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms. Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings. Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Tabitha L.

Defendant Brandon Alexander Lovingood in court with attorney Torrie R. Williams.  Defendant Brandon Alexander Lovingood in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  HMP
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grady, Branch 23.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
